Belgium: Abraham Ortelius' Theatrum Orbis Terrarum published in Antwerp.
Chile: Concepci√≥n is struck by an earthquake.
Cyprus:
Ottoman Turks invade Cyprus with 80,000 men.
Ottoman army besieges Nicosia.
Nicosia falls to the Turkish invaders. 20,000 Nicosians, Greek and Latin, are killed in the aftermath. About 1,000 survivors are bound and shipped out to be sold in the Constantinople slave markets.
Indinesia: Sultan Hairun of Ternate is killed by the Portuguese. The reign of Sultan Baabullah.
Ireland: Pope Pius V issues a papal bull, Regnans in Excelsis, declaring Elizabeth I of England a heretic and releasing her subjects from any allegiance to her.
Japan: Oda Nobunaga starts a 10-year long Ishiyama Hongan-ji War to suppress the warrior monk community and the Kaga ikki state.
Lebanon: The Maanid period reaches its peak with the reign of Fakhr ad-Din II. (to 1635)
Philippine: The Portuguese again attack the colony and are repulsed.
Legazpi sends an expedition under the leadership of Martin de Goiti to Manila.
Poland:
Signing of Sandomierz Agreement
Signing of the Treaty of Stettin concludes the Northern Seven Years' War
